reviews.name: Rosewill Line-M System Cabinet
reviews.reviewText: Had a 20 year old case the size of a dog house, transferred MB and cards into this case with ease....very compact, comes with a multitude of small screws, like thumb screws for removing panels, like dual fans included....very good case.
reviews.title: Great Architecture

reviews.name: Rosewill Line-M System Cabinet
reviews.reviewText: Its a really nice case. Everything fit perfect.
reviews.title: Beautiful case.

reviews.name: Rosewill Line-M System Cabinet
reviews.reviewText:
Pros:
* Small mATX tower case
* USB 3.0
* Holds everything I needed it to (HDD, SSD, DVD drive, USB card reader, PSU, FM2+ MoBo)
* Not ridiculous looking (very basic appearance)
* Comes with a speaker to hook up to your MoBo for debugging
* Comes with all black screws
* Comes with black zip ties
* Can fit a Cooler Master 212 (though not with side vent fans)

Cons: There are a few small negatives to the case, but none insurmountable:
* Tight working area
* Top-heavy build (50/50 my fault and cases fault)
* Not a lot of room for cable management

You can route the PSU mother board cable on the back side and tuck it in as much as possible to hide the slack. You can also route the CPU power cable around the top mounted PSU to reduce and hide slack as well.

I would suggest to mount any 3.5 HDD on the bottom to reduce the weight on the top. You will need to use cable ties to tidy cable management for cleaner look.

Would suggest to use a semi-modular PSU to reduce clutter such as the Corsair CX430M or similar.

Overall a value case for a budget build or even a entry level gaming case.
reviews.title: Quaility budget mATX case.
